edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.frontend
Class FrontEndLSP

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.frontend.FrontEndLSP
All Implemented Interfaces:
sdlip.Metadata, sdlip.Search
public class FrontEndLSP
extends java.lang.Object
implements sdlip.Search, sdlip.Metadata

The gateway into the entire SDARTS server - essentially an SDLIP LSP that understands STARTS. As a fully-compliant SDLIP LSP, FrontEndLSP implements the sdlip.Search and sdlip.MetaData interfaces. It also acts as a front to one or more underlying wrapped collections, each of which is accessible via an instance of BackEndLSP.

A FrontEndLSP initializes itself by getting a SDARTSConfig from a SDARTSConfigBuilder. It does this by reading in the sdarts_config.xml file, which must reside in the /config subdirectory of the server installation. During initialization, the FrontEndLSP creates each of the BackEndLSPs it is fronting, and initializes them.

The configurations of each BackEndLSP must reside in subdirectories of /config, each with the same name that the BackEndLSP is registered under.

Once it is initialized, the class performs the following functions:

  • Receives STARTS XML requests via SDLIP method calls from clients
  • Passes these requests as LSPObject headers to one or more underlying BackEndLSPs
  • Receives LSPObject replies from the BackEndLSPs
  • Converts these into SDLIP/STARTS XML, and returns them to the clients.

Communication with the BackEndLSP, which resides in the edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.backend layer, happens using LSPObject headers. These headers are all defined in the edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.common package.

In terms of communication with the client layer, the FrontEndLSP returns all of its data in a hybrid of STARTS and SDLIP XML format. See the edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.client package for more details, as well as the SDARTS design document.

Field Detail

backEndLSPs

protected java.util.Map backEndLSPs
Constructor Detail

FrontEndLSP

public FrontEndLSP()
            throws sdlip.SDLIPException
Creates a new FrontEndLSP. This should be done in the context of a server process - for example, the class SDARTS does this.

The FrontEndLSP will immediately look for its configuration file and configure itself. This file is of the XML format sdarts_config. The FrontEndLSP will look in the SDARTS.CONFIG_DIRECTORY directory for the file, which is called sdarts_config.xml.

It will then configure each of its BackEndLSPs, as they are described in its sdarts_config.xml file. The configurations of each BackEndLSP must reside in subdirectories of /config, each with the same name that the BackEndLSP is registered under.

Throws:
sdlip.SDLIPException - if something goes wrong during configuration

search

public void search(int clientSID,
                   sdlip.XMLObject subcols,
                   sdlip.XMLObject query,
                   int numDocs,
                   sdlip.XMLObject docPropList,
                   int stateTimeoutReq,
                   sdlip.XMLObject queryOptions,
                   org.omg.CORBA.IntHolder expectedTotal,
                   org.omg.CORBA.IntHolder stateTimeout,
                   org.omg.CORBA.IntHolder serverSID,
                   sdlip.XMLObject serverDelegate,
                   sdlip.XMLObject result)
            throws sdlip.SDLIPException
Implements the SDLIP Search interface method. The result of the search will be written into result, which is an OUT parameter.

See the SDLIP documentation for more information about this method.

Results will be returned as a combined SDLIP/STARS XML string of the form: 

 <SearchResult>
    <doc>
       <DID> 0...n </DID>
           <propList>
              <starts:sqresults>
                 . . . . . . .
              </starts:sqresults>
           </propList>
    </doc>
    .....
 </SearchResult>

There will be one <doc> element, with associated embedded STARTS XML, for each subcollection/back-end that is queried. The merging of STARTS and SDLIP means that there are some parameters in this method that duplicate items that appear in the STARTS XML query parameter. In addition, this framework does not support asynchronous or stateful searches. Below is the policy that results, described parameter by parameter.
Specified by:
search in interface sdlip.Search
Parameters:
clientSID - not used as this implementation is stateless
subcols - an SDLIP header that lists the subcollections to be queried. This overlaps with the "sources" element of the STARTS XML query. The policy is to search the union of sources in this parameter and what is in the STARTS header. Subcollections or sources are another name for BackEndLSPs.
query - the actual query. This should be STARTS XML in the form of <starts:squery> .... </starts:squery>.
numDocs - number of documents to be returned. This overlaps with the max-docs attribute of the STARTS query. The policy is to use the maximum of these two numbers for number of documents returned.
docPropList - this overlaps with the answer-fields element of STARTS. Because all metadata is also in STARTS format, it is possible that the fields in this parameter are not valid. Therefore, the policy is to ignore this parameter and use the information only in the STARTS header.
stateTimeoutReq - not used as this implementation is stateless
queryOptions - ignored, superseded by the STARTS header
expectedTotal - an OUT parameter. Will contain the sum of all numDocs attributes of the returned STARTS sqresults objects
stateTimeout - not used as this implementation is stateless
serverSID - not used as this implementation is stateless
serverDelegate - no delegation is implemented in this release
result - an OUT parameter. Contains a STARTS XML header of the form: < starts-header > < sqresults > .... < /sqresults > < /starts-header >.

getInterface

public void getInterface(sdlip.XMLObject theInterface)
                  throws sdlip.SDLIPException
Implements the sdlip.Metadata.getInterface() method. It writes the response as SDLIP XML into theInterface, which is an OUT parameter. See the SDLIP documentation for more information on how the response is formatted.
Specified by:
getInterface in interface sdlip.Metadata
Parameters:

getPropertyInfo

public void getPropertyInfo(java.lang.String subcolName,
                            sdlip.XMLObject propInfo)
                     throws sdlip.SDLIPException
Implements the sdlip.Metadata.getPropertyInfo() method. The caller specifies which "subcollection" or "SDARTS backend" to search.

The method's result is an SDLIP XML string of doctype < propList >, with the STARTS header < starts:smeta-attributes > embedded inside. See the SDLIP documentation for description of the SDLIP method, and the STARTS documentation for information about the < starts:smeta-attributes > tag

Specified by:
getPropertyInfo in interface sdlip.Metadata
Parameters:
subcolName - which subcollection (aka BackEndLSP) to return property information for
propInfo - an OUT parameter in which to write the response: an SDLIP XML string of doctype < propList >, with the STARTS header < starts:smeta-attributes > embedded inside.

getSubcollectionInfo

public void getSubcollectionInfo(sdlip.XMLObject subcolInfo)
                          throws sdlip.SDLIPException
Implements the sdlip.Metadata.getSubcollectionInfo() method. It writes the response as SDLIP XML into theInterface, which is an OUT parameter. See the SDLIP documentation for more information on how the response is formatted.

Basically, each "subcollection" described in the response corresponds to one BackEndLSP that this FrontEndLSP can serve.

Specified by:
getSubcollectionInfo in interface sdlip.Metadata
